homepage.title: HEAR-UI
homepage.subtitle: AI-Assisted Decision Support for Cochlear Implants
homepage.description: A web application that visualizes AI-powered predictions to support clinicians in assessing cochlear implant suitability and expected outcomes.
homepage.search_patients_text: Quickly find patients by ID, name or other criteria to review their data.
homepage.search_patients_image_alt: Illustration representing searching through patient records.
homepage.create_patient_text: Register a new patient and enter their clinical information for analysis.
homepage.create_patient_image_alt: Illustration representing adding a new patient.
homepage.prediction_text: Explore risk scores, model outputs and performance for your patients.
homepage.prediction_image_alt: Illustration representing risk prediction and analytics.
homepage.welcome_text: Welcome to Hear-UI, a project for predicting hearing loss.

form.title: Add new patient

error.name: Name must be at least 2 characters
error.imaging_type_preop: Select at least one imaging type
error.submit_failed: Failed to create patient. Please try again.
error.fix_fields: Please fix the highlighted fields and try again.

form.minimum_fields_hint: Gender, age and hearing loss (operated ear) must be filled in for a prediction to be calculated. Further clinical fields improve prediction quality.
form.minimum_fields_error: A prediction requires at least gender, age and hearing loss (operated ear). Please fill in these fields.

hints.german_language_barrier: Whether the patient has a German language barrier
hints.non_verbal: Whether the patient is non-verbal / uses sign language
hints.imaging_type_preop: Select all imaging modalities done pre-operatively
hints.hl_operated_ear: Type of hearing loss in the ear to be operated on
hints.amplification_operated_ear: Type of care performed on the ear to be operated on
hints.hearing_loss_onset: When did the hearing loss occur
hints.acquisition_type: How did the patient acquire the hearing loss
hints.hearing_loss_start: When did the hearing impairment begin
hints.duration_severe_hl: How long has the patient had severe HL or deafness
hints.hl_contra_ear: Hearing loss in the other ear
hints.amplification_contra_ear: Type of care performed on the opposite ear
hints.interval_days: Number of days between pre-op measure and operation date

descriptions.objective_oae: Capture the patient's OAE (TEOAE/DPOAE) measurement for objective assessment.
descriptions.objective_ll: Record the loudness level measurement result.
descriptions.objective_4k: Enter the 4000 Hz objective measurement value.
descriptions.hl_operated_other: Provide the specific description of the hearing loss in the operated ear.
descriptions.amplification_operated_other: Describe the amplification or care provided for the operated ear.
descriptions.hearing_disorder_other: Describe the hearing disorder type in your own words.
descriptions.ci_implant_other: Write the implant model or vendor if it is not listed.

result.title: Prediction result:
result.probability: Predicted probability of achieving clinically meaningful improvement in speech perception.

description.recommended: Based on the current audiological and clinical features, the AI model predicts a high probability of achieving clinically meaningful improvement in speech perception 24 months after implantation.
description.not_recommended: Based on the current audiological and clinical features, the AI model predicts a low probability of achieving clinically meaningful improvement in speech perception 24 months after implantation.

graph.title: Decision threshold
graph.description: Values above {{threshold}}% indicate that successful outcome is more likely than not.

feedback.question: Do you agree with the AI prediction?
feedback.comment_placeholder: Share your thoughts or additional information...
feedback.hint: Your feedback helps us improve the AI model.
feedback.required_error: Please choose whether you agree with the prediction.
feedback.submit_error: Error submitting feedback. Please try again.

patient_details.title: Patient details for
patient_details.delete_confirm_body: Are you sure you want to delete {{name}}? This action cannot be undone.

descriptions.objective_oae: Capture the patient's OAE (TEOAE/DPOAE) measurement for objective assessment.
descriptions.objective_ll: Record the loudness level measurement result.
descriptions.objective_4k: Enter the 4000 Hz objective measurement value.
descriptions.hl_operated_other: Provide the specific description of the hearing loss in the operated ear.
descriptions.amplification_operated_other: Describe the amplification or care provided for the operated ear.
descriptions.hearing_disorder_other: Describe the hearing disorder type in your own words.
descriptions.ci_implant_other: Write the implant model or vendor if it is not listed.

about.title: About the Prediction Models
about.description: This page provides access to the prediction models used in this application. You can view model cards to understand how they work, their performance, and their limitations.

step1.title: Step 1
step1.description: Find an existing patient using the search.

step2.title: Step 2
step2.description: Or create a new patient if they are not in the system.

step3.title: Step 3
step3.description: Navigate to the patient's detail page and verify their information.

step4.title: Step 4
step4.description: Click 'Generate Prediction' to see the model's output.

model_description.title: Model Description
model_description.description: Random Forest Classifier: Ensemble of decision trees, non-linear, robust predictions for heterogeneous patient characteristics

intended_use.title: Intended Use
intended_use.purpose_1: Support clinicians in estimating cochlear implant success probability
intended_use.purpose_2: Decision support tool for CI surgery planning
intended_use.purpose_3: Educational tool for demonstrating XAI methods in clinical decision-making
intended_use.not_intended_1: Autonomous clinical decisions without medical evaluation

limitations.title: Limitations
limitations.item_2: Not validated outside training population (University Hospital Essen)
limitations.item_3: Predictions are supportive evidence, not deterministic outcomes
limitations.item_4: Possible biases regarding age groups, gender, and type of hearing loss
limitations.item_5: Model performance may vary for edge cases not represented in training
limitations.item_6: Predictions less reliable with missing or incomplete data
limitations.item_7: SHAP interpretations show relative influence, not absolute causality

recommendations.title: Recommendations
recommendations.item_1: Use only as support tool – human medical judgment takes precedence
recommendations.item_2: Always interpret results in clinical context and considering patient history
recommendations.item_3: Use SHAP explanations to understand and critically evaluate predictions
recommendations.item_4: Regular evaluation and model updates recommended (e.g., every 6 months)
recommendations.item_5: For unexpected predictions: manually verify input data

performance.title: Performance / Evaluation
performance.hint: Note: Numbers serve as guidance, not sole decision-making basis.

features.title: Features
features.selected_note: Selected main features (complete list expandable in frontend)
features.language_desc: Primary language, additional languages, language barrier, non-verbal
features.imaging_desc: Cochlear malformation, ossification, otosclerosis, semicircular canal anomalies, brain pathology, normal findings
features.measurements_desc: LL, 4000 Hz (No response, threshold, not assessed)
features.hearing_desc: Hearing loss operated ear & contralateral ear, onset of hearing loss, etiology (sudden hearing loss, Menière's, infectious, syndromal), amplification, type of hearing disorder, acquisition pattern
features.treatment_desc: Manufacturer & model (Advanced Bionics, Cochlear, MED-EL, Oticon), electrode type/implant type

xai.title: Interpretability / XAI
xai.shap: SHAP Feature Importance is used to assess the influence of each variable on the prediction
xai.important_factors: Most important factors: Age, onset of hearing loss, CI type, imaging findings, hearing loss operated ear
xai.visualization: Visualization: Interactive waterfall and force plots in the frontend enable traceability and critical evaluation of each prediction

not_found.message: The page you are looking for does not exist.
